Struthers Wetting-Front Model for Infiltration, Redistribution, and Drainage with ET (Î¸â˜… / Î¸wp)

Tommaso Martini

2025-10-31

Source: vignettes/vignette.Rmd
vignette.Rmd

Overview

$$ \require{siunitx} % --- Macro usate nel testo --- \newcommand{\thstar}{\theta_{\star}} \newcommand{\thwp}{\theta_{\mathrm{wp}}} \newcommand{\ths}{\theta_{\mathrm{s}}} \newcommand{\thr}{\theta_{\mathrm{r}}} \newcommand{\dz}{\,\mathrm{d}z} $$

This vignette documents a frontâ€tracking water balance model that represents a vertical soil column of depth LL (m) with gravitational infiltration and redistribution (Iâ€“R), free drainage at the bottom (D), and evapotranspiration (ET) applied after each Iâ€“Râ€“D step. The state is stored as an ordered list of wetting fronts: {(xi,Î¸i)}i=1nF,0=x0<x1<â‹¯<xnFâ‰¤L, \{(x_i,\ \theta_i)\}_{i=1}^{n_F}, \qquad 0=\!x_0 < x_1 < \cdots < x_{n_F}\le L, where xix_i is the depth (m) of the ii-th front and Î¸i\theta_i is the volumetric water content (â€“) immediately above that front. By convention:

  • Front 1 is the deepest front (closest to LL);
  • Front nFn_F is the shallowest (closest to the surface).

Between two consecutive fronts xiâˆ’1x_{i-1} and xix_i the profile is piecewise constant at Î¸i\theta_i (rectangular layers). The residual and saturated water contents are $\thr$ and $\ths$, respectively.

We assume a Brooksâ€“Corey conductivity model $$ K(\theta) \;=\; K_s \left(\frac{\theta-\thr}{\ths-\thr}\right)^{1/b}, $$ with KsK_s [] and shape parameter b>0b>0.

Notation

  • LL [m]: profile depth.
  • Î´\delta [m]: depth at which the wetting model starts (often Î´=0\delta=0).
  • f(t)f(t) []: infiltration supply at the soil surface.
  • $\thstar$ (theta_star): stress onset threshold.
  • $\thwp$ (theta_wp): wilting threshold for transpiration.
  • ZrootZ_{\text{root}} [m]: active root-zone thickness from the surface; ZevapZ_{\text{evap}} [m]: active thickness for bare-soil evaporation.
  • epe_p []: potential evaporation (reference ET) per day; Cvâˆˆ[0,1]C_v\in[0,1] fraction allocated to transpiration on that day.

Infiltrationâ€“Redistribution Equations

Flux partition and front ODEs (Eqs. 7aâ€“7b)

Let qi(t)q_i(t) be the vertical flux immediately above front ii (positive downward). Over one sub-step Î”t\Delta t we partition the surface supply ff using the local conductivities: qi(t)=min(f(t),K(Î¸i))âˆ’min(f(t),K(Î¸iâˆ’1)),i=1,â€¦,nF, q_i(t) \;=\; \min\big(f(t),\, K(\theta_i)\big)\;-\;\min\big(f(t),\, K(\theta_{i-1})\big), \qquad i=1,\dots,n_F, with the convention K(Î¸0)â‰¡0K(\theta_0)\equiv 0. The layer water contents Î¸i\theta_i evolve with a gravitational balance (Struthers et al., Eqs. 7aâ€“7b). In discrete form with an explicitâ€“implicit Picard iteration on Î¸\theta, one time step Î”t\Delta t updates Î¸in+1â‰ˆÎ¸in+Î”tqi(Î¸(k))âˆ’K(Î¸i(k))+K(Î¸iâˆ’1(k))xinâˆ’xiâˆ’1n, \theta_i^{n+1} \approx \theta_i^{n} + \Delta t\, \frac{ q_i(\theta^{(k)}) - K(\theta_i^{(k)}) + K(\theta_{i-1}^{(k)})}{x_i^{n}-x_{i-1}^{n}}, where kk indexes the Picard iterate (all Î¸\theta updated simultaneously). Alternative formulations iterate on ğª=(q1,â€¦,qnF)\mathbf q=(q_1,\dots,q_{n_F}); both lead, after convergence, to the same mass update below.

Mass balance for front depths (Eq. 1)

Once Î¸n+1\theta^{n+1} and the integrated layer volumes are known, front depths are updated by the discrete mass balance Sin=(xinâˆ’xiâˆ’1n)(Î¸inâˆ’Î¸iâˆ’1n),Sin+1=Sin+qinÎ”t, S_i^{n} = (x_i^{n}-x_{i-1}^{n})\,(\theta_i^{n}-\theta_{i-1}^{n}), \qquad S_i^{n+1} = S_i^{n} + q_i^{n}\,\Delta t, xin+1=xiâˆ’1n+1+Sin+1max(Î¸in+1âˆ’Î¸iâˆ’1n+1,Îµ). x_i^{n+1} \;=\; x_{i-1}^{n+1} \;+\; \frac{S_i^{n+1}}{\max\!\big(\theta_i^{n+1}-\theta_{i-1}^{n+1},\,\varepsilon\big)}. Here Îµ\varepsilon is a small numerical tolerance. This update preserves column water mass by construction.

Free drainage (D) and merging

Free drainage is applied only to the shallowest front (index nFn_F) after the mass update: if xnFn+1>L,drainage=(xnFn+1âˆ’L)max(Î¸nFn+1âˆ’Î¸nFâˆ’1n+1,0),xnFn+1â†L. \text{if } x_{n_F}^{n+1} > L,\quad \text{drainage} \;=\; (x_{n_F}^{n+1}-L)\,\max(\theta_{n_F}^{n+1}-\theta_{n_F-1}^{n+1},0),\quad x_{n_F}^{n+1}\leftarrow L.

After Iâ€“Râ€“D, adjacent fronts are merged if either

  1. they overtake in depth: xiâ‰¥xiâˆ’1x_i \ge x_{i-1}; or
  2. their contrast is negligible: |Î¸iâˆ’Î¸iâˆ’1|<Ï„|\theta_i-\theta_{i-1}|<\tau; or
  3. (stability guard) a Î¸\theta inversion is detected, i.e.Â Î¸i<Î¸iâˆ’1\theta_i<\theta_{i-1} for some ii.

Merging conserves water volume by aggregating positive storage contributions Stot=âˆ‘jâˆˆâ„max[(xjâˆ’xjâˆ’1)(Î¸jâˆ’Î¸jâˆ’1),0],Î¸new=maxjâˆˆâ„Î¸j,xnew=xmin+Stotmax(Î¸newâˆ’Î¸min,Îµ). S_{\text{tot}} \;=\; \sum_{j\in\mathcal I} \max\bigl[(x_j-x_{j-1})\,(\theta_j-\theta_{j-1}),\,0\bigr], \quad \theta_{\text{new}} = \max_{j\in\mathcal I}\theta_j,\quad x_{\text{new}} = x_{\min} + \frac{S_{\text{tot}}}{\max(\theta_{\text{new}}-\theta_{\min},\varepsilon)}.

Evapotranspiration with $\thstar$ and $\thwp$

ET is applied after Iâ€“Râ€“D, without moving the front depths xix_i. Let the root-zone be [Î´,Î´+Zroot][\,\delta,\ \delta+Z_{\text{root}}\,]. Define the depth-weighted mean water content in the root zone: $$ \bar{\theta}_{\text{root}} \;=\; \frac{1}{Z_{\text{root}}}\int_{\delta}^{\delta+Z_{\text{root}}}\theta(z)\,\dz \;\approx\; \frac{1}{Z_{\text{root}}}\sum_{i\in \mathcal I(\delta,\delta+Z_{\text{root}})} \theta_i\,\Delta z_i^\ast, $$ where Î”zi*\Delta z_i^\ast is the fraction of layer ii that lies inside the root-zone.

Let Dt=epCvÎ”tD_t = e_p\,C_v\,\Delta t be the potential transpiration depth for the daily step, and Dbs=ep(1âˆ’Cv)Î”tD_{bs}= e_p(1-C_v)\Delta t the bare-soil potential evaporation depth.

Transpiration EtE_t (Eqs. 10â€“12, with $\thstar$, $\thwp$)

  1. Potential (unstressed) phase up to $\thstar$.
    Water needed to raise/reduce the mean to $\thstar$: $$ S_{\star} \;=\; \max\!\left(0,\ \bigl(\bar{\theta}_{\text{root}}-\thstar\bigr)\,Z_{\text{root}}\right), \qquad t_{\star} \;=\; \frac{S_{\star}}{D_t}. $$ If tâ‹†â‰¥Î”tt_{\star}\ge \Delta t then Et=DtE_t = D_t (all potential).

  2. Stressed phase between $\thstar$ and $\thwp$.
    The available storage above $\thwp$ in the root-zone is $$ S_{\mathrm{avail},\wp} \;=\; \int_{\delta}^{\delta+Z_{\text{root}}}\max\big(\theta(z)-\thwp,\,0\big)\,\dz. $$ The exponential form (Eq. 12, re-expressed in Î¸\theta) over the leftover time Î”tâˆ’tâ‹†\Delta t - t_{\star} gives the target $$ E_{t,\mathrm{stress}} \;=\; S_{\mathrm{cap}}\, \Bigl(1 - e^{-\,(\,D_t(\Delta t - t_{\star})\,)/S_{\mathrm{cap}}}\Bigr),\qquad S_{\mathrm{cap}} = (\thstar-\thwp)\,Z_{\text{root}}. $$ The total target is Ettarget=min{Savail,â„˜,Sâ‹†+Et,stress}E_t^\text{target} = \min\{\,S_{\mathrm{avail},\wp},\ S_\star + E_{t,\mathrm{stress}}\,\}.

  3. Application rule (volume removal).
    Remove EttargetE_t^\text{target}topâ€“down from the root-zone, reducing Î¸\theta of the shallowest layers first while enforcing $\theta\ge \max(\thwp,\thr)$. If a layerâ€™s storage (xiâˆ’xiâˆ’1)(Î¸iâˆ’Î¸iâˆ’1)(x_i-x_{i-1})(\theta_i-\theta_{i-1}) is exhausted, drop that front (merge).

Bare-soil evaporation EbsE_{bs} (Eq. 9)

Define the evaporative layer [Î´,Î´+Zevap][\,\delta,\ \delta+Z_{\text{evap}}\,] (typically Zevapâˆ¼0.05Z_{\text{evap}}\!\sim\!0.05â€“). Its available storage above $\thr$ is $$ S_{\mathrm{evap}} \;=\; \int_{\delta}^{\delta+Z_{\text{evap}}}\max\big(\theta(z)-\thr,\,0\big)\,\dz. $$ The daily target is $$ E_{bs}^\text{target} \;=\; S_{\mathrm{evap}}\, \Bigl(1 - e^{-\, D_{bs}/S_{\mathrm{evap}}}\Bigr), $$ applied topâ€“down within [Î´,Î´+Zevap][\,\delta,\delta+Z_{\text{evap}}\,] while enforcing $\theta\ge\thr$.

Multilayer transpiration (Eq. 18)

If transpiration is split across multiple active layers j=1,â€¦,Jj=1,\dots,J (e.g.Â surface and deep roots), distribute the potential demand as $$ f_j \;=\; \frac{\displaystyle \sum_{i\in \mathcal I_j} \Big(\max(\theta_{i,j},\thwp) - \max(\theta_{i-1,j},\thwp)\Big)} {\displaystyle \sum_{m=1}^{J}\sum_{i\in \mathcal I_m} \Big(\max(\theta_{i,m},\thwp) - \max(\theta_{i-1,m},\thwp)\Big)}, \qquad \sum_j f_j = 1, $$ and apply the two-phase rule independently in each layer with Dt(j)=fjDtD_t^{(j)}=f_j\,D_t.

Numerical safeguards

  • Clamp $\theta\in[\thr,\ths]$.
  • Merge when |Î¸iâˆ’Î¸iâˆ’1|<Ï„|\theta_i-\theta_{i-1}|<\tau, on overtake, or on Î¸\theta-inversion.
  • When applying ET with very large targets, sub-cycle the removal to avoid multiple front deletions in one call.

Example: 40â€‘day simulation with hourly subâ€‘steps

The following example demonstrates Iâ€“Râ€“D with daily ET using $\thstar$ and $\thwp$. Units are meters and days.

library(strutR) # if packaged

theta_r <- 0.05
theta_s <- 0.45
beta <- 1 / 5
Ks <- 1.0 # m/day
L <- 2.0
delta <- 0.0
tol_merge <- 1e-6

# ET thresholds and settings
theta_wp <- 0.08
theta_st <- 0.20
Z_root_series <- rep(0.40, 40) # m
Z_evap <- 0.10 # m top layer for bare-soil evaporation
Cv <- 0.7 # canopy fraction
dt_day <- 1.0 # day

# Initial profile: dry uniform, one deepest front at L
fronts <- list(list(theta = 0.12, x = L))

# Forcings
set.seed(1)
ndays <- 40
rain_mm <- rep(0, ndays)
rain_mm[3:4] <- 15
rain_mm[10] <- 25
rain_mm[15] <- 35
rain_mm[28:30] <- 10
rain_mm[35] <- 20
f_day <- rain_mm / 1000 # m/day

ETp_mm <- rep(3, ndays)
ETp <- ETp_mm / 1000 # m/day potential ET

dt_sub <- 1 / 24
sub_steps <- as.integer(1 / dt_sub)

profiles_daily_preET <- vector("list", ndays)
profiles_daily_postET <- vector("list", ndays)
drainage_daily <- numeric(ndays)
E_t_daily <- numeric(ndays)
E_bs_daily <- numeric(ndays)
for (d in seq_len(ndays)) {
  # Infiltrationâ€“Redistributionâ€“Drainage over the day (24 substeps)
  f_t <- f_day[d]
  for (k in seq_len(sub_steps)) {
    step <- struthers_redistr_under(
      fronts, theta_r, theta_s, beta, Ks,
      L = L, delta = delta,
      f_t = f_t, # m/day
      dt_sub = dt_sub, # day
      infill_all = FALSE,
      debug = FALSE,
      theta_field_capacity = NA_real_,
      Z_1 = NA_real_,
      tol_merge = tol_merge
    )
    fronts <- step$fronts
    drainage_daily[d] <- drainage_daily[d] + step$drainage
  }
  profiles_daily_preET[[d]] <- fronts

  # Daily ET: transpiration (Î¸â˜…/Î¸wp) + bare-soil evaporation (no movement of x)
  et <- apply_ET(
    fronts      = fronts,
    ep          = ETp[d], # m/day potential ET
    Cv          = Cv, # fraction to transpiration
    dt          = dt_day, # one-day ET step
    theta_star  = theta_st,
    theta_wp    = theta_wp,
    theta_r     = theta_r,
    theta_s     = theta_s,
    Z_root      = Z_root_series[d],
    Z_evap      = Z_evap,
    delta       = delta,
    debug       = FALSE,
    tol_merge   = tol_merge
  )
  fronts <- et$fronts
  E_t_daily[d] <- et$E_t
  E_bs_daily[d] <- et$E_bs

  profiles_daily_postET[[d]] <- fronts
}

Daily profiles (preâ€‘ET vs postâ€‘ET) 

days_to_plot <- c(1, 3, 4, 5, 10, 15, 16, 30, 33)

op <- par(no.readonly = TRUE)
par(mfrow = c(3, 3), mar = c(4, 4, 2, 1))
for (dd in days_to_plot) {
  plot_single_profile(theta_r, theta_s, profiles_daily_preET[[dd]],
    soil_depth = L,
    timestep = paste0("Day ", dd, " (preâ€‘ET)"),
    Z_1 = delta + Z_root_series[dd], Z_2 = delta + Z_evap,
    colore = "steelblue"
  )
  # overlay postâ€‘ET in red
  theta_i <- vapply(profiles_daily_postET[[dd]], function(fr) fr$theta, numeric(1))
  x_i <- vapply(profiles_daily_postET[[dd]], function(fr) fr$x, numeric(1))
  ord <- order(x_i)
  theta_i <- theta_i[ord]
  x_i <- x_i[ord]
  lines(c(theta_i[1], theta_i, theta_r, theta_r),
    c(0, x_i, x_i[length(x_i)], max(x_i)),
    type = "s", lwd = 2, col = "firebrick"
  )
  legend("bottomright",
    inset = 0.02, bg = "white", cex = 0.8, bty = "n",
    legend = c(
      sprintf("Rain: %g mm", rain_mm[dd]),
      sprintf("E_t: %.1f mm", 1000 * E_t_daily[dd]),
      sprintf("E_bs: %.1f mm", 1000 * E_bs_daily[dd])
    ),
    text.col = c("black", "firebrick", "gray40")
  )
}

par(op)

Depthâ€‘averaged $\bar\theta(0,z^\*)$ time series 

depths <- c(0.05, 0.10, 0.20, 0.40, 1.0)
depths <- depths[depths <= L]
Theta_bar_pre <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = ndays, ncol = length(depths))
Theta_bar_post <- matrix(NA_real_, nrow = ndays, ncol = length(depths))
colnames(Theta_bar_pre) <- paste0("0â€“", depths, " m")
colnames(Theta_bar_post) <- paste0("0â€“", depths, " m")

for (d in seq_len(ndays)) {
  for (j in seq_along(depths)) {
    Theta_bar_pre[d, j] <- compute_weighted_avg_theta_by_depth(
      profile = profiles_daily_preET[[d]],
      depth_limit = depths[j], theta_r = theta_r, delta = delta, L = L
    )
    Theta_bar_post[d, j] <- compute_weighted_avg_theta_by_depth(
      profile = profiles_daily_postET[[d]],
      depth_limit = depths[j], theta_r = theta_r, delta = delta, L = L
    )
  }
}

cols <- c("black", "steelblue", "darkgreen", "orange", "red")
par(mar = c(4, 4, 2, 1))
plot(1:ndays, Theta_bar_pre[, 1],
  type = "l", lwd = 2, col = cols[1],
  xlab = "Day", ylab = expression(bar(theta) ~ "(0â€“z)"),
  ylim = range(Theta_bar_pre, Theta_bar_post, na.rm = TRUE),
  main = expression("Depthâ€‘averaged " ~ bar(theta) ~ " (pre/post ET)")
)
for (j in seq_along(depths)) {
  lines(1:ndays, Theta_bar_pre[, j], col = cols[j], lwd = 2, lty = 2)
  lines(1:ndays, Theta_bar_post[, j], col = cols[j], lwd = 2)
}
legend("topleft",
  bg = "white", cex = 0.85,
  legend = paste0(colnames(Theta_bar_pre), " (solid=post, dashed=pre)"),
  col = cols[seq_along(depths)], lwd = 2, lty = c(1, 2)
)

Daily diagnostics 

par(mfrow = c(1, 2), mar = c(4, 4, 2, 1))
plot(seq_len(ndays), 1000 * drainage_daily,
  type = "h", lwd = 2,
  xlab = "Day", ylab = "Drainage [mm]", main = "Daily drainage"
)
abline(h = 0, lwd = 1)
plot(seq_len(ndays), 1000 * (E_t_daily + E_bs_daily),
  type = "h", lwd = 2,
  xlab = "Day", ylab = "ET [mm/day]", main = "Daily ET (total)"
)
abline(h = 0, lwd = 1)

References
